  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36610].
  {panel}

Currently, the Confluence REST API documentation is point to:
https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest/

It will be better to let the customer aware of the Documentation is separated by Confluence version in the URL:
https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST 
To avoid being using the documentation on a wrong version of Confluence.
fields.summary: Let the customer aware of REST API doc based on the Confluence version

fields.description:
Currently, Code Macro is not recognised as compatible in Confluence version above 5.5.7 by Confluence Update Check (Confluence Admin >> Manage add-ons >> Confluence Update Check) because information in the Marketplace has not been updated yet. (see [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/manage/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-publish-plugin/versions])

Despite that, the plugin is actually compatible and it is bundled in Confluence 5.6 version and above.

This create confusion in the user as the information by the compability checker/update checker is unreliable.
fields.summary: Code Macro is not recognised as compatible plugin in Confluence above 5.5.7 version

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36598].
  {panel}

Currently if you have similar worded filters and you search with a keyword while inserting the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics on a Confluence Page, only a limited number of results will display.

Allow for at least one of the following:

# Direct JQL
# Insertion of Filter ID
# Insertion of name without having to select from dropdown
# Add *Advanced search* like in Jira when looking for a filter in a gadget
# List all filters in dropdown

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36593].
  {panel}

It's been a few days now that the merge cell function doesn't in our Confluence instance. We have used merge cells before, and it worked fine, but now it seem impossible to use this feature.

Test Case:
1. Create a table
2. Select 2 cells
3. click Merge Table Cells

Expected Result: Cells are merged into one cell
Actual Result: Nothing happens. Cells are not merged.

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.6 the G1 garbage collector was selected as the preferred option.

However, it has come to light that there may be problems with Lucene under this GC algorithm.

See -
* https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/LUCENE-5168
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8038348

The Lucene project team themselves report a risk of index corruption, and while Atlassian has seen no evidence of this on our own servers, or heard any customer reports yet, it is prudent to follow the Lucene team's advice and switch our default garbage collector back to the concurrent one.
fields.summary: It is reported that the G1 garbage collector can cause index corruption

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate*
Navigate to this link https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-roadmap-plugin

*Observed behaviour*
Confluence roadmap plugin is supported only by Confluence Server 5.6 - 5.6.6

*Expected behaviour*
Confluence roadmap plugin is bundled with Confluence 5.7 as stated in this [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes?showComments=true&showCommentArea=true#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Planyourroadmapvisually]. The site should be updated to avoid user to confused.
fields.summary: Confluence Roadmap plugin site is not updated

*Workaround*
# Delete any previously failed, half-imported space.
# Shut down Confluence.
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
DISABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
# Start Confluence.
# Import Space.
# Shut down Confluence again.
# Run the following query in database:
{code}
alter table
CONTENT_PERM
ENABLE constraint
CP_UNIQUE_USER_GROUPS;
{code}
(!) *Please backup your database before running the above query.*

fields.description:
If you put a task report macro into the body of a user macro it will not render correctly on the page. An easy way to test this is to create a user macro with the below velocity code and the *Macro body processing* set to *Rendered*.

{code}## @noparams
$body{code}

In our environment it will also interrupt the display of the left hand navigation and throw a JavaScript error.
fields.summary: Task report won't work in the body of a user macro

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36585].
  {panel}

This is a feature request to provide ability to restrict/allow the following actions in single Confluence pages, that the user have made a comment:

# Restrict Editing of comments that a user has entered. For example, once the comment is done in that page, you need to add a new one in order to not edit it. 
# According to the comment restriction, give the ability to see the edit performed and who have edited the comment.
# Restrict the comment to be edited/removed only be the user that have done it. This would also not allow the confluence-administrators users to make the modifications.
fields.summary: Permission Level for Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36582].
  {panel}

After creating a page in versions 5.4 or higher, you can create a JIRA Issue in Confluence by highlighting text on the page.  After the issue is created, it is automatically added to the page and there is a normal page update event fired.

This should be distinguishable from normal page edits.  

This is a significant issue for plugins that listen to the PageUpdatedEvent to trigger functionality based on pages actually being updated.

This should also be distinguishable in the page history.

fields.description:
We recently converted our documentation to use the deck of cards for easier navigation, but unfortunately this broke our table of contents on the same page. 

There are a couple of workarounds (see comment), but they are very messy and not sustainable over the lifespan of the page. If someone creates a new page, for instance, the workaround ToC does not update.

Repro: 
1) Open a page with a working ToC
2) Add the Deck of Cards macro
3) Add Cards for the number of headings you need
4) Put top-level headings into each Card under Deck of Cards
5) Save. Note that the ToC now only works if selecting items from the currently open card.
fields.summary: Table of Contents Breaks When Deck of Cards Macro is Used

The task list looks ok but the comments box becomes transparent and floats up to the middle of the page. Please see the screenshot attached [^FloatingComments.png]

fields.description:
*Bug Description*

# Access Confluence using Internet Explorer 9, a [supported browser|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] of Confluence 5.7
# Upload a pdf file into a page
# Create a link to the recently attached pdf file
# Save the page
# Click the pdf file link created

*Expected behaviour*

Confluence should be able to preview the file successfully in IE 9 as it is a [supported platform|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] and pdf file is one of the [priviewable files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Filesarefirstclasscitizens].

*Result*

Confluence unable to preview the file with the warning message as describe in the screenshot below:

!pdfpreview.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

* {{Viewfile}} pdf is still working in IE9.
* In order to open the link without downloading the file, user can use "Open in New Tab" option.
* Disable {{Confluence Previews}} plugin (PDF will be viewed as prior to Confluence version 5.7)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36560].
  {panel}

h3.Step to replicate
# Create a page with a Task Report Macro 
# Change the language setting  for the user to a non English language
# Go back to the page.

h3. Expected Result
The Task Report Macro is displayed in the selected languages


h3. Observed Result
The Headers of the Task Report Macro are not translated even when a different languages is selected.
!test_1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Cause
The mismatch occurs when the user's language is different from the global language. In some places, the global language is preferred over the user's.

h3. Workaround
If it is feasible, ensure that the global language (Confluence Admin > Languages) is set to the same language as the end user's. The end user should also ensure that their browser language is set to their preferred language.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36559].
{panel}
The new [File Preview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Displaying+Files+and+Images] does not support viewing video attachments e.g mp4, mov. Upon clicking on a link to video attachment, the dialog shows:
{quote}We can't preview this file.
 You'll have to download the file to view it.
{quote}
At least, the feature should allow playing videos in the browser.

Previously, clicking on a link to video attachment will play the video in the browser (handled via browser plug-in). The new behaviour forces the user to download the video file to view it.

Alternative to this feature - use the [Multimedia macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Multimedia+Macro].
h3. Notes

If you are experiencing issues displaying video files in 5.10.x or later, you may still have your *attachments stored in the database*, rather than on disk. See the following [KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/unable-to-preview-pdf-attachments-in-google-chrome-and-ie-836141397.html] for further details.
fields.summary: Support video file types in File Preview

fields.description:
Multibyte characters ( like Japanese or Chinese ) does not get rendered in Confluence 5.7

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Upload Excel file which contains Japanese characters to a page in Confluence. 
# Click on the spreadsheet

h4. Actual results
Japanese characters are displayed as squares.

h4. Findings 
This issue does not happen when using Office Excel macro
This issue does not happen on Word documents
This issue does not happen when Confluence runs on Windows 7

h4. Solution
This bug has been "fixed" in Confluence 5.8.8, but you +*still*+ need a directory that contains the fonts used to create the document (please follow the *Plugin Configuration* section). There are +*no*+ workarounds for this (except in some very specific cases see the "Optional configuration" section below), but to get the best rendering for all file types you will need the original fonts.

h5. {color:red}Caveats:{color}
* If you're running 5.7 or 5.8 you can replace the existing plugin used to do the rendering with the fixed version. We can't provide support for this method, but it's being mentioned here to help those who can't upgrade their Confluence instance right away. We strongly recommend testing this on your staging instance before making any changes to your production environment.
* Replacing the plugin +*can't*+ be done using the "Manage Add-ons" administration screen due to the size of the plugin (it may work if your instance has enough heap allocated to Java, but your system will use more memory after installing it this way, so please +*don't do this*+ and follow the provided instructions instead).

h5. Plugin installation
To install the plugin on your system safely, do the following:

# Stop your Confluence instance. 
If you are running Confluence in a cluster, all nodes must be stopped, and the following steps repeated on each node (we are manually replacing a plugin, so if all the nodes are not stopped there's the chance that nodes may run with different versions of the library, which will cause all sort of problems)
# Go to your Confluence home directory, and go to the {{plugins-osgi-cache/transformed-plugins/}} directory.
# Delete any {{document-conversion-library-1.X.XX_YYYYYY.jar}} files there, where X and Y are numbers (the numbers will be different, depending on your Confluence version). There can be more than one (depending on how many upgrades you've done to your instance). Please check the name of the file, there is a similar file called {{confluence-document-conversion-library...}} which should +*not*+ be touched.
# In your Confluence installation directory, go to {{WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins}} and delete the file {{document-conversion-library-1.X.XX.jar}}. There should only be one this time.
# In the same directory, copy the new plugin jar {{document-conversion-library-1.2.12.jar}}, provided at the end of this description.

h5. Plugin configuration
Now that we have the plugin installed, we need to specify a directory with all the fonts. This directory +*won't*+ be recursively searched, so don't add any sub-directories as they won't be used.

# We need to specify the following parameter to Confluence as a JVM argument: {{confluence.document.conversion.fontpath}}. To do so, you can modify the {{setenv.sh}} (or {{setenv.bat}} if you're running Confluence under Windows Server) and add the following to {{CATALINA_OPTS}}: {{-Dconfluence.document.conversion.fontpath=/your/font/path}}. See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties for more information on how to do this.
# If you want Confluence to re-render all existing thumbnails & PDFs, remove the files rendering cache from the Confluence shared home directory (if you're not on cluster, there should be a {{shared-home}} directory in the Confluence home directory). Remove {{dcl-document}} (containing the PDF previews) and {{dcl-thumbnail}} (containing the thumbnails). +*Be aware*+ that this will trigger Confluence to re-render every document. It will do this as people visit pages containing files, not all at once.
# If you don't remove the files rendering cache, the new fonts will be visible the next time somebody uploads a new document, or uploads a new version of an existing file.
# Start Confluence. 
# To confirm the change, go to the "Manage Add-ons" administration screen. Search for "Document Conversion Library" and check that you're running version 1.2.12.

h5. Optional configuration
Other JVM flags that were added and might help with this issue:
||Flag||Default value||Description||
|confluence.document.conversion.words.defaultfontname| |The name (not the path) of the default font that will be used for Word rendering ({{.doc}} and {{.docx}}). A default font can be specified here that contains all the glyphs for your language(s)|
|confluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.regular| |The name (not the path) of the default font that will be used for Powerpoint rendering ({{.ppt}} and {{.pptx}}) for regular fonts|
|confluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.asian| {{TakaoPGothic}} |The name (not the path) of the default font that will be used for Powerpoint rendering ({{.ppt}} and {{.pptx}}) for asian fonts|
|confluence.document.conversion.slides.defaultfontname.symbol| |The name (not the path) of the default font that will be used for Powerpoint symbols rendering ({{.ppt}} and {{.pptx}}). This is the font that will be used for bullets and other symbols when the font {{Symbol}} is not found|

The new plugin can be downloaded here: https://maven.atlassian.com/service/local/repositories/atlassian-public/content/com/atlassian/plugins/document-conversion-library/1.2.12/document-conversion-library-1.2.12.jar
fields.summary: Multibyte characters don't get rendered in Confluence 5.7 on Linux

fields.description:
In general,  Java application including Confluence needs addtional font files to display the multibyte characters on its GUI.  For example,  to display Japanese characters in ppt file with Viewfile macro on Confluence/Linux,  we have to install Japanese font files (msgothic, msmincho, ipa) into "JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/fonts/fallback/" .

But even deploying Japanese font files into "JAVA_HOME/jre/lib/fonts/fallback/" which Confluence uses,  viewfile macro can't display the Japanses characteres in TextBox of Word (doc/docx).
(ASCII characters which is included in same fonts tyoe are displayed as expected in TextBox correctly)

It seems there are something wrong in Confluence libraries. 

Regards,
fields.summary: Viewfile macro can't display the multibyte characters in TextBox of Word file (doc/docx)

- Create a new link.
- Place the cursor inside the link and use the {{cmd + k}} keyboard shortcut to open the link dialog
- Hit save without making any changes in the dialog

*Expected results*: The link gets modified
*Actual results*: The link gets duplicated

Note that the duplication happens immediately, without having to save the page. Ivan may have been able to hit this issue despite making changes to the link in the dialog, and using the property panel button, but the steps above are the easiest way to consistently reproduce the issue.
fields.summary: Link created in the editor gets duplicated when edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36546].
  {panel}

I see from the related issue that you did add CQL, but I was talking about using it Inside of a Macro to return CONTENT, not a just a list of pages from the search bar. I want to return content from pages by using CQL parameters. This would be useful.

You could match on labels, creation time, space, attachments, whether it has children, etc.

You could match on some of the attributes here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/confluence/latest/reference/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html


I ran into the need when I wanted to include all of the pages of the children of a parent essentially the cross between the page include and the children include macros. However there were so many pages it would be very tedious to do so with page includes.

 I started writing a macro for it, but I don't think we should need to make our own macros to do something so simple.  The Macro I was writing nearly works, but it doesn't include the macros that are on the pages of the children, so all panels and other stuff are lost essentially.

Even that however, was a workaround for what I really needed.

What I really needed was to include the content of all children of a certain parents who matched a certain creation date. So I could have 1 dynamic page, whose content changed day to day based on which pages matched the creation date parameters. A shift log that would always have content from  a time-span of 24-0 hours ago.

Now if CQL worked with the page include macro, then that would solve my issue.
fields.summary: CQL to return content WITHIN a Macro

fields.description:
The Page Name parameter of 'Office Excel' and all similar macros is not updated when the page containing the file to show is moved and the page is in another space. The automatic update in the same space works.

This also applies for all macros using activateSmartFieldsAttachmentsOnPage.

Steps to reproduce:
a) create a page which contains an Excel file
b) create a second page in the same space which uses the Excel file of page a) as input for the 'Office Excel' macro.
c) create a third page in a different space which uses the Excel file of page a) as input for the 'Office Excel' macro.
d) rename page a)

Observed: Page b) shows no error, page c) does.
Expected: both pages show no error
fields.summary: Page Name parameter of 'Office Excel' is not updated when source page is renamed and page is another space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36514].
  {panel}

Confluence is not able to detect existing database with contents in it (except Confluence database). Confluence will overwrite any existing database with contents in it (except any existing Confluence database) during database setup. Unlike Jira or Crowd, Confluence will not prompt any warning to the user if the chosen database contains any contents in it. Instead, it automatically overwrites and creates Confluence tables in the chosen database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence.
# Start Confluence Setup in the browser.
# Choose *Production Installation*.
# Enter License Key.
# Select *External Database* option under *Database Configuration* page.
# Choose *Direct JDBC* option.
# Insert the URL for any database that contains contents.
(i.e. MySQL: {{jdbc:mysql://localhost/jiradatabase?sessionVariables=storage_engine%3DInnoDB}})
# Click *Next*.
# Observe the results.
# Execute the following SQL query via a database client to examine the database Confluence installed on:
{code:sql}SHOW tables;{code}

h3. Expected Behaviour
!prompt.png|thumbnail!
* Confluence setup should prompt a warning to the user before overwriting any existing database with contents.
* Confluence should also check whether the tables cwd_* are existed in the database, as the name is shared across all Atlassian Product. 

h3. Actual Behaviour
• Confluence will proceed database setup if the chosen database wasn't a Confluence database.

h6. Note
(!) This has been tested with any kind of databases (i.e. Jira, Crowd or custom database).
fields.summary: Confluence database detection should included the embedded crowd tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting a Space to HTML fails if the attachment file in any page within the target Space is missing in the filesystem.
The HTML export fails with the following message:
{code}
There was an error in the export. Please check your log files. :java.lang.NullPointerException 
{code}

PDF and XML exports still work, bypassing the missing attachment.
Accessing the page with the missing attachment also works.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla instance of Confluence.
 #* This was validated on versions *6.0.3*, *6.13.6* and *6.15.4*, including both _Server_ and _Data Center_ deployments.
# Create a sample _Space_.
# In that Space, create a sample _Page_.
# In that Page, go to *...* > *Attachments* and upload any file.
# Find the attached file in the file system and delete it.
 #* Refer to [Hierarchical File System Attachment Storage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/hierarchical-file-system-attachment-storage-704578486.html] so you find the right file.
# In the sample Space, go to *Space tools* > *Content Tools* > *Export*.
# In _Export Formats_, choose *HTML* and click on *Next*.
# In _Export HTML Options_, choose *Normal Export* and click on *Export*.

The HTML export is created and the file can be downloaded by the user.
Confluence gracefully handles the missing file during the export.

|WMF|XLS| |
|EMF|XLSX| |
|ICO| | |
|ICNS| | |

fields.description:
When removing someone from a Team Space, that person remains a watcher of that space, which means they will still receive notifications for the space. 

Users should be removed as watchers of the space and should not receive notifications relating to it.

h3. Workarounds:
# Ask the user to remove the watch from the space
# If you are a sysadmin, you could log in as that user by resetting their password, and remove the watch from their account (if you have considered and are comfortable with this option)
fields.summary: Removing a user from a Team Space does not remove them from the watchers of that space

fields.description:
Inside com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-roadmap-plugin:view-roadmap-javascript:app/templates.soy there's a large inlined data-uri image. It's for the thumbnail in the editor. 

We should optimise this image using imageoptim and make it external, using the same technique we did inside atlassian-nav-links - using a LESS file with url(path/to/image) instead of an inlined data-uri. Having this image inside .soy is a bit of a code smell.

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-nav-links/pull-request/43/confdev-28847-removing-inline-images is the PR for the fix for atlassian-nav-links which was similar.
fields.summary: Confluence Roadmap Plugin includes large 71KB inline data-uri image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36497].
  {panel}

Note: If you are using version 5.8.16 or 5.8.17, or have used those versions in the past without running a script to fix the affected files, then you are likely affected by CONF-39975. Please see that ticket instead.

We found out that some of our Confluence pages have "unknown attachments". There are multiple pages that shows "unknown attachments". 
Here are some details:
- Attachment images are still there and can be viewed in some pages, but some other page attachments are gone and also not visible in the page.
- This is not true for all. Some pages have no attachment images at all, but the images are visible with in the page.
- Workaround is to re-add the attachment image to the macro but since we don't know how many pages are effected, it would be better if there is a fix to apply.
- We are not sure if it is caused by moving pages within or another space, but this issue is now found in many other spaces.

Confluence version: 5.4.4

*Note* This issue was resolved in favour of CONF-41067, which has much more clarity. Please follow that issue after reading the description if you still think this affects you.

(i) Note that the plugin is not disabled

*Workaround*
Disable Analytics Client Plugin from Manage add-ons -> System add-ons
fields.summary: Confluence throws /rest/analytics/1.0/publish/bulk for events when Analytics is Disabled

fields.description:
Changing the color of text in a bulletted list with multiple hierarchy levels produces unexpected results.  In some scenarios, only the top level of the selected hierarchy changes colors.  In other scenarios, some bullets are deleted and collapsed or reordered.

To recreate the issue, create a bulletted list with one or more bullets including a sub-bullet.  Highlight at least two top level bullets where the first bullet includes sub-bullets and change the text color.
fields.summary: Changing Text Color in a Bulletted List

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36492].
  {panel}

Many Cloud instances have experienced problems with copying, deleting or creating new pages. 

Some Cloud instances are having a problem where the following error message appears after trying to copy or create a new page:

a description of your problem and what you were doing at the time it occurred
a copy of the error and system information found below
a copy of the application logs (if possible).
Your Confluence administrator can use the support request form to create a support ticket which will include this information.
We will respond as promptly as possible.
Thank you!
Return to site homepage…

fields.description:
In Confluence 5.6 we added a Monitoring Console to Confluence, accessible by going to Admin Console > Monitoring Console. It appears in Confluence 5.7 this link is no longer there.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install Confluence 5.7
# Go to the Admin Console
# Scroll to the bottom, to the Administration panel

h3. Expected behavior
You would see a link to the Monitoring Console
!monitor_56.png!

h3. Actual behavior
There is no link to the Monitoring Console
!monitor57.png!

h3. Related Notes
* The console is still accessible by accessing it directly via URL
** <base_url>/admin/monitoring-console.action
fields.summary: Link to Monitoring Console Missing
Upload attachment from URL

fields.description:
Normally if you upload a new version of an attachment, any comment is wiped clear.  This is the expected behavior.

However if you add a new version of an attachment by using Edit in Word (making any change and saving will add a new version of the attachment), the comment is duplicated (and unable to be changed).

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page and save it.
# Go to Tools > Attachments
# Attach a document which is able to be edited using "Edit in Word"
# Add a comment
# Edit the document using "Edit in Word" and save it
# Go back to Tools > Attachments 
# Expand the attachment row to see both versions
# See the duplicated comment (which is unable to be edited)
fields.summary: Attachment comments are duplicated in new versions created by Edit in Word

fields.description:
[Our documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Surviving+Database+Connection+Closures] says we can modify the preferred test query by setting that parameter. However, with Confluence 5.7 and possibly older versions, it does not appear to work.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
* Start Confluence 5.7 with a debugger attached
* Add to confluence.cfg.xml {code:xml}<property name="hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery">select 1</property>
<property name="hibernate.c3p0.validate">true</property>{code}
* Set a breakpoint in testPooledConnection in C3P0PooledConnectionPool and you will notice that the test query is null, which eventually ends up calling com.mchange.v2.c3p0.impl.DefaultConnectionTester#activeCheckConnectionNoQuery which does a getTables() call on the connection metadata instead of issuing the test query specified.

h3. Workaround:
Add the system property - c3p0.preferredTestQuery - with the validation query that is appropriate for your database. The added system property will be used as default value and picked up by c3p0 connection pool when getting a new connection.
||Database Type||Validation Query||
|MySQL|select 1|
|Microsoft SQL Server|select 1|
|Oracle|select 1 from dual|
|PostgreSQL|select 1|

For example:
{code}
-Dc3p0.preferredTestQuery="select 1"
{code}

Refer to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+System+Properties for more information on how to configure system properties.

h3. Workaround 2:
Run the steps in this guide to switch from [jdbc to datasource|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+SQL+Server+Datasource+in+Apache+Tomcat]. Be sure to back up the files indicated in Step 1.

(!) Please be sure not to skip the section starting with "If you're changing an existing Confluence installation over to using a datasource" in Step 4.
fields.summary: hibernate.c3p0.preferredTestQuery is ignored in confluence.cfg.xml

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36483].
  {panel}

When I insert an Office/Excel document display macro, it comes with a link that says "Edit this document" above the rendered document in the page.

It is very irritating to have a link like this, where it invites you to click on it, but then says "ha ha, you can't do that, you have the wrong browser".

You should either detect that I have the wrong browser and not offer me the link, or give me the option in the macro to not show that link.

No-one in our organisation uses Firefox or IE.

Hello,
one of our clients asks about the ability to select multiple pages in a space or even in different spaces and apply label to a batch of selected pages.
He says, and I quote: " I would like to be able to select multiple pages in the wiki and the add/remove a label to all of the pages at once. Currently, you have to add labels one page at a time.  This is painful when you decide to gather a bunch of content under a new label.
This is a feature request to Atlasssian not a support ticket."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36476].
  {panel}

After Confluence Cloud was upgraded to 5.7-OD-42, the contributors macro stopped working properly. Not all watchers are added, even thought 'watchers' is selected.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Have a 5.7-OD-42 Confluence Cloud instance (only tested in JIRA+Confluence ones)
* Create a page (you should be automatically added as watcher, if not, do it)
* Add the contributors macro to it
** Contribution type:
{noformat}
authors,comments,mentions,watches
{noformat}
*** Leaving only 'watches' also reproduces the problem
** Sort by: name
** Display format: list
** The rest is empty

*Expected result*
* The page's author should be part of the list
** (S)he is both author and watcher

*Actual Result*
* The following message:
{noformat}
No contributors found for: watches on selected page(s)
{noformat}

Sometimes, when changing the macro and saving it. It starts working for no reason.

Reports seem to indicate that it worked before the upgrade.
fields.summary: Contributors Macro is not working properly for Watchers after update

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36474].
  {panel}

Although the following documentation mention MySQL to be supported, the two most common flavors of MySQL are not specifically listed as ones that likely will cause issues.
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL

MariaDB and Percona are proven to cause problems with Confluence and we have open feature requests to support those (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36471, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29060), but since the documentation do not specifically mention they are not supported, in many cases users will make the assumption they are okay to use.
fields.summary: Documentation request: mention not supported flavors of MySQL
